title: Tabouleh with quinoa and tuna

ingredients.content: ½ tsp fine salt, plus 1 pinch extra to taste
½ lemon, preferably organic (grated zest and juice only)
20 g spring onions, cut into pieces (optional)
3 - 4 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves washed and dried
2 - 3 sprigs fresh mint, leaves washed and dried
100 g tomatoes, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
100 g canned tuna, in brine or water, drained well

preparations.content: Place water and ½ teaspoon salt into mixing bowl and bring to the boil: <b>8 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add quinoa and cook <b>12 min/100°C//speed <b>. Strain quinoa using simmering basket and transfer to a large bowl. Dry mixing bowl.
Combine the grated zest and juice of the lemon with the quinoa and mix.
If used, place garlic clove, spring onions, coriander and mint into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Chop again <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, 1 pinch of salt to taste, tomatoes and chilli and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.
Add cucumber, tuna and chop <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer mixture into bowl with quinoa and mix with aid of spatula.

hintsAndTricks:
A diet for fitness requires a good portion of lysine and iodine to maintain an excellent psychophysical balance and guarantee optimum athletic performance.
In addition to these elements, tuna and quinoa are also excellent sources of potassium, iron, calcium and B vitamins, which are essential for various biological functions, for example, muscular contraction, the transmission of nerve impulses within the body and the transport of oxygen to the tissue.
